intro: Pedicularis brunoniana subsp. typica, commonly known as the typical brunoniana lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant is hemiparasitic, meaning it partially depends on host plants for nutrients through its roots. It typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often in rocky or gravelly soils. Its unique floral structure and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
